item.title: "For the second time in four years, fears that a Democrat...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"For the second time in four years, fears that a Democrat would be elected president sent private prison stocks plummeting earlier this month. To the casual observer, the prospect of President-elect Joe Biden—who promised to “stop corporations from profiteering from incarceration”—presented an existential threat to the multi-billion dollar industry.This article was published in partnership with Slate.But the big players in private prisons, CoreCivic and Geo Group, are not pan...icking—and rumors of their impending demise have been exaggerated. That’s because they’ve been steadily diversifying, placing their bets on a future that includes revenue from commercial real estate, electronic monitoring, and halfway houses.

On a quarterly earnings call just two days after the election, CoreCivic CEO Damon Hininger was asked about the possibility that a Biden administration may end the company’s contracts with the federal Bureau of Prisons. He replied confidently, “We think our risk is pretty minimal there.” He noted that back in 2010, the agency accounted for 15 percent of the company’s revenue. Today it’s just 2 percent.The companies still care which party controls the government: A Newsweek analysis of political contributions from GEO and CoreCivic’s political action committees found that both heavily favored Republicans in political donations during the 2020 cycle. About 95 percent of GEO’s nearly $1 million in donations went to GOP candidates and the party, as did more than 87 percent of CoreCivic’s $181,000."

See MoreCoreCivic and GEO Group have been shifting away from prisons toward other government contracts, like office space and immigration detention.

themarshallproject.org

Think Private Prison Companies Are Going Away Under Biden? They Have Other Plans

CoreCivic and GEO Group have been shifting away from prisons toward other government contracts, like office space and immigration detention.CoreCivic and GEO Group have been shifting away from prisons toward other government contracts, like office space and immigration detention.
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: "In a sweeping change to its immigration practices, Mexico...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"In a sweeping change to its immigration practices, Mexico has stopped holding migrant children and their families in detention centers, bowing to international pressure from human rights groups that criticized the practice as inhumane.

The reform, which took effect this week, also gives migrant children temporary legal status in Mexico in order to avoid immediate deportation and allow time for them to seek legal avenues for staying in the country.

[...]

...

Mexico’s immigration agency, which runs detention centers, opposed the reform [...]"

See MoreThe United Nations said the reform is an 'historic advance' in human rights

vice.com

Migrant Children Will No Longer Be Held in Detention in Mexico

The United Nations said the reform is an 'historic advance' in human rightsThe United Nations said the reform is an 'historic advance' in human rights

item.title: Abolish ICE DenverShowing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver📣Call To Action📣 Contact Your Denver City Council people (including...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE DenverShowing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

📣Call To Action📣

Contact Your Denver City Council people (including At-Large - Ortega & Kniech) and ask:

• What is the status of collective bargaining with Denv...er Police Dept?
• Will you commit to allow the police contract to go to arbitration?
• Will you commit to no raises for DPD?

DEMAND - no new raises for Denver Police Department!

A 2-year contract with DPD is not just irresponsible, it is immoral. The current contract allows DPD to lock in a $5M raise in 2022 while no other city employees are allowed to collectively bargain AND face drastic cuts to their agency budgets. The 2021 budget includes minor increases to programs designed as alternatives to policing (STAR, etc.) with funding from external sources – these budgetary increases did not decrease the DPD budget in any way.

Tell your councilperson to stand firm and say NO to this contract!

item.title: On June 25, under the pressure of mass protests against racist...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

On June 25, under the pressure of mass protests against racist police killings, Governor Jared Polis issued an executive order which would open an independent investigation into Elijah McClain’s death, led by state Attorney General Phil Weiser. This was after Aurora District Attorney Dave Young declined to file any charges against the killers, then the city of Aurora opened a sham investigation led by a former cop which was terminated because it was plainly not “independent”.... Now it is up to Phil Weiser to decide whether the cops and paramedics responsible for Elijah’s death will face any criminal charges.

But just this week, Governor Polis quietly loosened the scope of the investigation, allowing Weiser to investigate for “offenses”, not just “criminal activity” related to Elijah’s death, opening up the possibility for him to come back with watered down charges against the killers, like we saw in Breonna Taylor’s case. Polis also took out the words that suggest someone caused the death of Elijah McClain.

Polis must think that the movement isn’t paying attention, that we’ve been subdued by the repressive arrests of movement leaders, and now he can reel back his investigation without opposition in the streets. He is wrong.

Join us for an emergency action to make it clear that we are still here and we are not going anywhere until we get justice for Elijah McClain!

MASKS REQUIRED (OVER YOUR NOSE & MOUTH!) & PLEASE KEEP DISTANCE BETWEEN YOURSELF AND OTHERS.

See More

SAT, NOV 21 AT 1:00 PM MST

EMERGENCY ACTION: Eyes on Weiser! Justice for Elijah McClain!

Colorado State Capitol

· DenverCauses · 393 people

item.title: Most inmates at the El Paso County jail weren’t given masks...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Most inmates at the El Paso County jail weren’t given masks until AFTER the jail became one of the state’s largest COVID-19 outbreaks when hundreds of inmates tested positive. Hundreds of people in shared living spaces had zero masks until last week.

The more than 1,200 inmates inside the El Paso County jail on any given day were not provided masks until last week, when the jail became the site of Colorado’s second-largest coronavirus out…

denverpost.com

El Paso County jail inmates weren’t given masks prior to one of Colorado’s largest COVID-19 outbreaks

item.title: Nearly 150 protesters marched through the streets of downtown...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Nearly 150 protesters marched through the streets of downtown Denver denouncing both presidential candidates on Thursday, November 5, 2020.

A popular chant throughout the evening was “No borders, no walls, no USA at all!”

The protest was advertised based on a flyer and language from CrimethInc.’s EVERYBODY OUT! Resources for a Season of Post-Election Unrest, which was published prior to election day.

item.title: Abolish ICE Denver+8Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverTonight PSL joined in a car caravan from the GEO Aurora ICE detention center...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver+8Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Tonight PSL joined in a car caravan from the GEO Aurora ICE detention center to the Denver County Jail and Denver Women’s Correctional Facility to say FREE THEM... ALL!

Across the country, millions of people are trapped in ICE detention, jails, and prisons during this deadly global pandemic. Thousands have needlessly died, and hundreds of thousands have been infected. We demand mass humanitarian release NOW! #FreeThemAll

item.title: Abolish ICE DenverColorado People's AllianceThese are the consequences of leaving the health of folks at the hands of a corporation. GEO is...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE DenverColorado People's Alliance

These are the consequences of leaving the health of folks at the hands of a corporation. GEO is not keeping our community safe. We need you to take action today...!
✅ Call ICE and demand the release of everyone at the detention center on humanitarian parole (720) 873-2899
✅Call Warden Johnny Choate and demand that he provides proper medical care for everyone in need (303) 361-6612
✅ Sign-up to be a volunteer for COPA's Detention Lifeline
email raul@coloradopeoplesalliance.org

Estas son las consecuencias de dejar la salud de las personas en manos de una corporación. GEO no mantiene segura a nuestra comunidad. ¡Necesitamos que actúes hoy!

✅ Llama a ICE y exige la liberación de todos en el centro de detención en libertad condicional humanitaria (720) 873-2899
✅Llama al alcaide Johnny Choate y exige que brinde atención médica adecuada a todos los necesitados (303) 361-6612
✅ Regístrate para ser voluntario de la línea salvavidas para detenidos de COPA envia un correo electrónico a raul@coloradopeoplesalliance.org

item.title: Abolish ICE DenverThis live video has ended.November 9 at 4:50 PMCaravan and Vigil - #FreeThemAllThis video is now available to watchWatch...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE DenverThis live video has ended.

November 9 at 4:50 PM

Caravan and Vigil - #FreeThemAllThis video is now available to watchWatch NowColorado People's Alliance was live.

***seguido por español***
#COVID19 threatens the lives of everyone imprisoned, with outbreaks in more than two dozen carceral setting in Colorado right now. We ...know #DetentionIsDeadly and the only safe course of action for people in cages, the workers at those facilities and the #publichealth is to #FreeThemAll.
*** #COVID19 representa una amenaza a toda nuestra gente encarcelada. Colorado se encuentra con brotes en mas de dos docenas en lugares carcelarios ahora mismo. Sabemos que la detención es mortal y que el único curso de acción seguro, tanto para las personas en jaulas, los trabajadores en estos lugares y la #saludpublica es liberarlos a todos.

Immigration and Customs Enforcement’s decision to return to business as usual and the GEO detention center in Aurora are not keeping our community safe. Experts like Dr. Carlos Franco Paredes are calling for compassionate humanitarian release of all imprisoned people. Tonight, we will hear from loved ones of those jailed, impacted individuals and the Immigrant Freedom Fund of Colorado about how your donations can free our people!
***La decisión de la migra de regresar a operativos “normales” conjunto con como GEO maneja su centro de detención, ponen en peligro la seguridad de nuestra comunidad. Expertos como Dr. Carlos Paredes están clamando por una liberación humanitaria de todas las personas encarceladas. ¡Esta noche escucharemos de los seres queridos de la gente aprisionada, de personas detenidas y del Fondo de Liberación de Inmigrantes en Colorado sobre como sus donativos pueden rescatar a nuestra gente!

This event is brought to you by the American Friends Service Committee, the Colorado People’s Alliance, the Colorado Freedom Fund AND the Immigrant Freedom Fund of Colorado.
****Este evento es patrocinado por el Comité de Servicio de los Amigos Americanos en Colorado, Colorado People’s Alliance, Colorado Freedom Fund Y TAMBIEN el Immigrant Freedom Fund of Colorado.

item.title: Conditions are extremely difficult for our @denverpsl comrades inside.Lillian, Joel & Eliza are dealing with...
item.content:encoded: Conditions are extremely difficult for our @denverpsl comrades inside.Lillian, Joel & Eliza are dealing with difficulties accessing medication and sanitary products, serious COVID risks, abuse from guards, and intense stress from isolation (23+ hours a day). Their civil rights are also being violated with Denver, Adams and Arapahoe County working together to deny our comrades a bond hearing. Our comrades suffer yet they are still thinking of others — constantly telling communjty about the conditions of their cell mates and others in the jail and agitating for their release as well. @justiceforelijahmcclain PSL Denver and Say Their Names 5280 are heroes and freedom fighters. And we need to be fighting harder than ever for them. See you Saturday!
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver
